summary.long: 1 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
Grace to you and peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God always for all of you, constantly mentioning you in our prayers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remembering before our God and Father your work of faith and labour of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know, brothers loved by God, that he has chosen you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because our gospel came to you not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction. You know what kind of men we proved to be among you for your sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you became imitators of us and of the Lord, for you received the word in much affliction, with the joy of the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you became an example to all the believers in Macedonia and in Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For not only has the word of the Lord sounded forth from you in Macedonia and Achaia, but your faith in God has gone forth everywhere, so that we need not say anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they themselves report concerning us the kind of reception we had among you, and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to wait for his Son from heaven, whom he raised from the dead, Jesus who delivers us from the wrath to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know, brothers, that our coming to you was not in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But though we had already suffered and been shamefully treated at Philippi, as you know, we had boldness in our God to declare to you the gospel of God in the midst of much conflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our appeal does not spring from error or impurity or any attempt to deceive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but just as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel, so we speak, not to please man, but to please God who tests our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we never came with words of flattery, as you know, nor with a pretext for greed—God is witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor did we seek glory from people, whether from you or from others, though we could have made demands as apostles of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother taking care of her own children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, being affectionately desirous of you, we were ready to share with you not only the gospel of God but also our own selves, because you had become very dear to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you remember, brothers, our labour and toil: we worked night and day, that we might not be a burden to any of you, while we proclaimed to you the gospel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses, and God also, how holy and righteous and blameless was our conduct towards you believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know how, like a father with his children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we exhorted each one of you and encouraged you and charged you to walk in a manner worthy of God, who calls you into his own kingdom and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we also thank God constantly for this, that when you received the word of God, which you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of men but as what it really is, the word of God, which is at work in you believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, brothers, became imitators of the churches of God in Christ Jesus that are in Judea. For you suffered the same things from your own countrymen as they did from the Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and drove us out, and displease God and oppose all mankind
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by hindering us from speaking to the Gentiles that they might be saved—so as always to fill up the measure of their sins. But God's wrath has come upon them at last!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we were torn away from you, brothers, for a short time, in person not in heart, we endeavoured the more eagerly and with great desire to see you face to face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we wanted to come to you—I, Paul, again and again—but Satan hindered us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what is our hope or joy or crown of boasting before our Lord Jesus at his coming? Is it not you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are our glory and joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when we could bear it no longer, we were willing to be left behind at Athens alone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we sent Timothy, our brother and God's co-worker in the gospel of Christ, to establish and exhort you in your faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no one be moved by these afflictions. For you yourselves know that we are destined for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when we were with you, we kept telling you beforehand that we were to suffer affliction, just as it has come to pass, and just as you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason, when I could bear it no longer, I sent to learn about your faith, for fear that somehow the tempter had tempted you and our labour would be in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now that Timothy has come to us from you, and has brought us the good news of your faith and love and reported that you always remember us kindly and long to see us, as we long to see you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this reason, brothers, in all our distress and affliction we have been comforted about you through your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For now we live, if you are standing fast in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what thanksgiving can we return to God for you, for all the joy that we feel for your sake before our God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as we pray most earnestly night and day that we may see you face to face and supply what is lacking in your faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus, direct our way to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and may the Lord make you increase and abound in love for one another and for all, as we do for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, then, brothers, we ask and urge you in the Lord Jesus, that as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God, just as you are doing, that you do so more and more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know what instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of God, your sanctification: that you abstain from sexual immorality;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that each one of you know how to control his own body in holiness and honour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not in the passion of lust like the Gentiles who do not know God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that no one transgress and wrong his brother in this matter, because the Lord is an avenger in all these things, as we told you beforehand and solemnly warned you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not called us for impurity, but in holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore whoever disregards this, disregards not man but God, who gives his Holy Spirit to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning brotherly love you have no need for anyone to write to you, for you yourselves have been taught by God to love one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that indeed is what you are doing to all the brothers throughout Macedonia. But we urge you, brothers, to do this more and more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may walk properly before outsiders and be dependent on no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not want you to be uninformed, brothers, about those who are asleep, that you may not grieve as others do who have no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For since we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so, through Jesus, God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this we declare to you by a word from the Lord, that we who are alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, will not precede those who have fallen asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a cry of command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the sound of the trumpet of God. And the dead in Christ will rise first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air, and so we will always be with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore encourage one another with these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need to have anything written to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves are fully aware that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While people are saying, “There is peace and security”, then sudden destruction will come upon them as labour pains come upon a pregnant woman, and they will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not in darkness, brothers, for that day to surprise you like a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are all children of light, children of the day. We are not of the night or of the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then let us not sleep, as others do, but let us keep awake and be sober.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, are drunk at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we belong to the day, let us be sober, having put on the breastplate of faith and love, and for a helmet the hope of salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not destined us for wrath, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who died for us so that whether we are awake or asleep we might live with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore encourage one another and build one another up, just as you are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ask you, brothers, to respect those who labour among you and are over you in the Lord and admonish you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to esteem them very highly in love because of their work. Be at peace among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we urge you, brothers, admonish the idle, encourage the faint-hearted, help the weak, be patient with them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that no one repays anyone evil for evil, but always seek to do good to one another and to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice always,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: pray without ceasing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not quench the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not despise prophecies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but test everything; hold fast what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abstain from every form of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the God of peace himself sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who calls you is faithful; he will surely do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, pray for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I put you under oath before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
